result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roderick R Neal Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Roderick R Neal Jr. Defendant Roderick R Neal Jr. not in court, in custody.   Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Roderick R Neal Jr. not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Roderick R Neal Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. 
Defense counsel has not received an offer from the State and has received discovery and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roderick R Neal in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roderick R Neal appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Roderick R Neal in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Roderick R Neal in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roderick R Neal appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
